skill.name: Design Specification Extraction
skill.description: Extract comprehensive JSON design specifications from visual sources including Figma exports, UI mockups, screenshots, or live website captures. Produces W3C DTCG-compliant output with component trees, suitable for code generation, design documentation, and developer handoff.
skill.summary: Extract design tokens and component specifications from screenshots into W3C-compliant JSON
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. All file I/O is explicitly scoped to user-specified directories. No network calls, external commands, or environment access. Operates entirely through AI prompting.

content.value_statement: Manually extracting design tokens from screenshots and mockups is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill uses a 7-pass AI process to systematically extract colors, typography, spacing, components, and accessibility details into standardized W3C DTCG JSON format ready for code generation.
actual_capabilities: Extract color palettes with semantic mappings (background, foreground, interactive, feedback)
Identify typography scales including font families, sizes, weights, and line heights
Map UI components to hierarchical trees with bounding boxes and atomic levels
Detect spacing scales and dimension tokens (radii, borders, containers)
Analyze accessibility compliance (WCAG contrast, touch targets, semantic structure)
Generate W3C DTCG-compliant JSON output with confidence scores
limitations: Requires visual input (screenshot, Figma export, or mockup) to analyze
Cannot access live websites or browsers directly
Hover states and interactions must be inferred or provided as separate images
Accuracy depends on image quality and resolution

use_cases.title: Extract Design System Tokens
use_cases.description: Convert visual designs into code-ready design tokens for consistent implementation across your codebase.

use_cases.title: Reverse Engineer UI Mockups
use_cases.description: Analyze screenshots of competitor UIs or inspiration to extract specs for rapid prototyping.

use_cases.title: Generate Design Documentation
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive design documentation from mockups for developer handoff and design system maintenance.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Design Specification Extraction skill to analyze the attached screenshot. Create .design-specs/my-project directory and run all 7 passes to produce design-spec.json following the W3C DTCG format.

prompt_templates.title: Figma Export
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this Figma export image using the design-spec-extraction skill. Focus on extracting the complete color palette, typography scale, and component hierarchy. Output to .design-specs/{project-name}/.

prompt_templates.title: Accessibility Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the Design Specification Extraction skill with focus on Pass 6 (States & Accessibility). Analyze the screenshot for contrast issues, touch target sizes, and missing ARIA labels. Report findings in the accessibility section.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-State Components
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract component specifications including all visible states (default, hover, active, disabled). Use the 7-pass extraction but emphasize Pass 4 (Component Detection) and Pass 6 (States) for complete interactive element documentation.

best_practices: Use high-resolution source images for accurate color and measurement extraction
Provide multiple screenshots if analyzing hover or interactive states
Include the design tool name (Figma, Sketch, XD) for higher confidence scoring
anti_patterns: Using low-resolution screenshots leads to inaccurate color values and missed components
Expecting live website analysis - this skill analyzes static images only
Skipping intermediate passes reduces cross-validation and may miss details
Not validating the final JSON against the schema before using in production

faq.question: What image formats are supported?
faq.answer: PNG, JPG, and WebP formats work best. Ensure high resolution (at least 1x display density) for accurate extraction.

faq.question: Can this extract from live websites?
faq.answer: No. The skill analyzes static images. Take a screenshot of the website or use a Figma/Sketch export for best results.

faq.question: How accurate are the color values?
faq.answer: Colors are estimated visually from the image. High-resolution images yield results within 1-2% of the original design tokens.

faq.question: Is my design data shared anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All file I/O is local to your project directory. No data is sent to external servers beyond the AI model context.

faq.question: How do I use the output for code generation?
faq.answer: The JSON output follows W3C DTCG format and can be imported into Style Dictionary, Tailwind Config, or design system tools.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual design handoff?
faq.answer: This skill automates the tedious process of manually noting colors, measurements, and component specs. It produces structured, machine-readable output instead of static documentation.
